The threshold is set to %2$.0f°, which is below the minimum %1$.1f° the Sun will reach now. The widget will show %3$s on the home screen.
The widget will show the current angle and the time range when the Sun is above %1$.0f°.
The widget will show the current angle and the time range when the Sun is below %1$.0f°.

What can I see? 
￼ 
The widget shows the height of the Sun. This position is measured by the Altitude angle, the angle between the horizon and the Sun. 
 
Threshold 
You can choose an angle as a threshold. The widget will calculate the time range the Sun is above or below this height. 
 
The time range will be bold when the Sun is in the right position. 
The time will be highlighted (like this) for the 30 minutes while the Sun approaches the threshold. 

For example: when the threshold is set to above 0°, the widget can be used as a soft alert for sunrise/sunset. 
 
Hide parts of the widget 
Open the Options menu (︙) in the Sun Widget Settings to do so. You can show/hide the Part of The Day and Last Update time displays on the home screen. This is helpful in case your device's Launcher App doesn't give enough space for the widget, and it looks crammed.
